item.title: Hugo Theme Development Part II - Centering images in Hugo
item.author: Author
item.description: The problem As i was using hugo to build my blog, i encountered and unexpected snag. The page contained an image which i wanted to appear on the page centered. It’s sounds like a 16-character problem solved straight out of muscle memory, right? Howerver, we can not centered image with markdown itself. The shortcodes of Hugo Hugo authors are acutely aware of the problem, and so Hugo does come with a solution of sorts shortcodes (and {{ <figure> }} shortcode in particular).

item.title: Hugo Theme Developlment Part I
item.author: Author
item.description: .Content In hugo, you can use .Content to get the rendered content of your markdown file. And it’s looks like below; 1 2 3 4 5 your content ... your code ... your content Hidden the code What if your want to add a toolbar to add some ability, like copy or hidden the content of code. Since the render of hugo will ouput the content directly, we need to write a javascript to add additional content for rendered markdown file.
